direction.raw_text: An expensive bathroom suite. Excess of marble and gold taps. Into the bath, a hand is scattering rupee notes. Hundreds and hundreds of notes, worth hundreds of thousands of rupees. The sound of a fist thumping on the bathroom door, furious shouting from the other side.

He would surely turn and run but for the iron grip on his shoulder of the smiling host, Prem Kumar.

direction.raw_text: Welcome to Who Wants To Be A Millionaire! More applause.

Why don't you save us both a lot of time? Hmm? Jamal doesn't answer. The Inspector sighs and sits down. Looks at his watch, nods at Constable Srinivas again. Jamal's body jerks with electric current. When the shudders and screams have subsided, the Inspector goes over to Jamal's collapsed form. Clicks his fingers in front of Jamal's face to check for a response.

direction.raw_text: Vinod! Musketeers coming through! Without breaking step, they both jump expertly over the stream of piss. Not so the Security Guard who gets it all over his trousers, but doesn't stop the pursuit. The two children charge past a shack filled to the roof with chickens in cages who all start squawking. They break out into the sunlight of the `main road' of the slum lined with shops. It is packed: with people, stalls, bicycles and cows. All modern India is here, drinking tea, shouting at each other, selling food, playing carom, video games. Leaving a trail of shouting and wreckage behind them, the pair approach a brand new Mercedes almost blocking the lane. Beside it stands Javed, an impressive man in a beautiful suit and his two Minders. Jamal and Salim skid to a stop, put their hands together in respectful greeting and edge ever so carefully past the immaculate paintwork of the car. Still in pursuit, the Security Guard also slides carefully past the car with deprecating bows and smiles. On past the chi stall where a crowd has gathered to watch a hindi film blaring from the tv rigged up overhead. The irate Security Guard gets tangled up in a bicycle. Jamal and Salim stop to give him a taunting, hip-gyrating parody of the dance on the tv before scooting down another tunnel. They break out into sunlight again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jamal! Jamal skids to a halt, bumping into Salim who is already frozen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit. Mummy-ji.

direction.raw_text: Don't you move a muscle. The Security Guard arrives and he too skids to a halt at the sight of Jamal's mother.

direction.raw_text: Thank you, Mister Gupta. I will deal with these two. The Guard puts his hands together in grudging respect as Jamal's Mother lifts each skinny kid off the floor by their t-shirt and marches them down the road.

The ball flies overhead again from Salim to Krishna. Jamal dives for it, misses and goes underwater. When he comes up for air, he shakes his head, clearing his ears of water. Then he stops, listens. Shakes his head again. Definitely something strange. Thunder? Salim and Krishna are trading catches, unaware that anything has changed. But Jamal's mother has heard it too. The faintest sound of shouting, roaring. The wave of noise is still faint but getting louder. A frozen moment broken by:

As they head down the alley, they get glimpses of burning houses, fleeing women, a three- year old boy in a doorway, painted entirely in garish blue. He stares at them. direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where you going?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: First class, bhai. Where else?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 72   INT/ EXT. FIRST CLASS CARRIAGE. MORNING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We criss-crossed the country from Rajasthan to Calcutta. Every time we were thrown off we got back on again. This was our home for years. A home with wheels and a whistle. The final tumble as they crash onto flat ground. 73   EXT. RAILWAY EMBANKMENT. DAY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Salim? Is this heaven?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're not dead, Jamal. Jamal clears his head. Sees Salim picking himself up from the ground. But the apparition is still there. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 73   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wow. They stare at the apparition. The unmistakable outline of the Taj Mahal rises from the horizon, pink in the morning sun. Nothing could be more beautiful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some hotel, huh? 74   EXT. TAJ MAHAL. DAY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...there are five main elements to the Taj. The Darwaza, the main gateway, the Bageecha or garden, the Masjid or mosque, the Naqqar Khana, the rest house and the Rauza or mausoleum. If you would like to follow me, I will show you the ninety-nine names of Allah on Mumtaz's tomb. As before, please remove your shoes. Jamal follows the Guide and his entourage into the mausoleum. Salim meanwhile is studying the line of shoes. Tries a smart pair of women's court shoes, before slipping a foot into a nice, white sneaker. A smile crosses his face. His other foot quickly follows and he saunters away, all mock-innocence. 75   EXT. TAJ MAHAL. DAY                                       75 Jamal comes out of the mausoleum into the bright sunlight and looks around for Salim. No sign of him. Suddenly, a German couple approach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, what time is the next tour?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Err-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - so much waiting around in this damned country. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 75   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I- ADA - we're on a very tight schedule, you see, young man. Have to see the Red Fort this afternoon. Would it be possible to show us around now? Obviously we understand it would cost more for just the two of us... Peter waves a couple of thousand rupee notes at Jamal. His eyes widen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But of course, Madam. Please follow me. Jamal stalks off. The Germans follow. Jamal stops before the monument. Points a confident arm at it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is....the Taj Mahal. A terrible pause as Peter and Ada stare at him. Clearly more is expected. He moves off at a pace.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Taj Mahal was built by the Emperor Khurram for his wife Mumtaz who was maximum beautiful woman in the whole world. When she died, the Emperor decided to build this five star hotel for everyone who wanted to visit her tomb...but he died in- in fifteen eighty-seven, before any of the rooms were built. Or the lifts. The swimming pool, however, as you can see was completed on schedule in top class fashion. He waves confidently in the direction of the fountains.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It says nothing of this in the guide book.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With respect, Madam, the guide book is written by a bunch of lazy, good-for-nothing, Indian beggars. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 75   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And this, Lady and Gentleman, is burial place of Mumtaz.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How did she die?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A road traffic accident.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maximum pile-up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thought she died in child- birth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Exactly, Sir. She was on the way to the hospital when it happened. Jamal moves on. Ada and Peter exchange a glance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've seen the way they drive around here... 76   EXT. TAJ MAHAL. DAY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was the best-paid job I've ever had.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is the Princess Diana seat, Madam. Allow me. Jamal shows the tourist a battered postcard of Princess Diana, staring doe-eyed into the distance with the Taj behind. The tourist sits. Jamal adjusts her legs so that they match the postcard. Takes the photo....
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tourist police! (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 76   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 77   EXT. TAJ MAHAL. DAY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 78   EXT. ROADSIDE MARKET. AGRA. DAY.

direction.raw_text: Top-class fashion, bottom-class prices! Shoes for all! Shoes for all! 79   EXT. BOYS CAMP, YAMUNA RIVER. DAY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And life was good. 80   EXT. SLUM. DAY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is the biggest dhobi ghat in the whole of India, Mister David. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 80   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They say that every man in Uttar Pradesh is wearing a kurta that has been washed here at least one time.

direction.raw_text: Is that so? That's amazing. Let's get a look at this, Adele. He gets out his video camera and wanders towards the dhobi ghat. Behind them a motor rickshaw pulls up. Salim, Shankar and a couple of the street kids from the Taj leap out. Within seconds, the Mercedes is up on bricks and the wheels are being removed. Salim takes a hacksaw to the Mercedes badge on the bonnet, whilst urging the others on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are, sala! Formula One, Formula One! Pit-stop ka speed, Schumacher ka ishtyle The crowds in the lane barely notice as the car is stripped of all its parts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go, go! A shout from the top of the lane and the boys scatter, bouncing the four wheels at speed down the lane. Jamal, the Indian driver and the two Americans return. They stop in front of the denuded car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Woah. What happened here? Suddenly the Indian driver is slapping Jamal ferociously around the head with one of his shoes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I give you two tight slaps, mader chod!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know! I didn't do it, did I...? Nothing to do with me...get off! But the beating continues, the driver kicking Jamal down onto the floor. The two Americans stare, uncertain what to do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do something, Clark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I- I dunno, I- Finally Clark intervenes, pulling the driver off Jamal. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 80   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, okay, just cool it. You're insured, aren't you? Jesus Christ... Jamal sits up. He is bleeding from his nose and mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You wanted to see the `real India', Mister David. Here it is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, here's a bit of the real America, too, son. Adele pulls out his wallet and rummages for dollars. 81   EXT. YAMUNA RIVER. NIGHT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oi, Jamal! There's a woman with no panties on over here. Jamal reaches up and easily lifts a wallet from a man's trouser pocket. On stage, the actors start singing. Jamal seems to have forgotten the wallet and stares, mesmerised, at the stage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why don't you put it back and listen to the music? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 83   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's called Orfeo. Orpheus and Eurydice. Orpheus- that one there- is looking for his lover, Eurydice. She died, but he can't live without her. She hands him a cigarette. He puts the wallet back. She smiles at him and they both turn to the stage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The pain is so bad that he goes to the underworld- the place we go when we die- to try to get her back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't do that. Can you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can in opera.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Does he find her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watch and see. Jamal watches as Orpheus sings one of the most beautiful pieces of music a human is likely to hear. Tears are running down Jamal's cheeks. 84   EXT. YAMUNA RIVER. NIGHT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Woah! What are you- Jamal?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have to go, Salim.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go? Go where? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 84   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bombay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't be stupid. We're making good money here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We should have gone a long time ago. Salim turns to Shankar with sudden understanding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, God. Baby brother's in love. With a flat-chested hijra.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Latika was one of us. A musketeer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A musketeer...Grow up, Jamal. Look, how was I to know they'd beat you up. Here, you can have some of the cash. Come on...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've got cash. He rips out a wad of dollar bills from his pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dollars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Enough. I'm getting my stuff. He walks off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait! Jamal! Ah, shit! He gets up, kicks the fire in rage and stomps after Jamal. 85   INT. STUDIO. NIGHT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, my friend: ready for another question. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 85   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Prem presses his computer. The lights dim again, the music comes up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For a straight one million rupees, Ladies and Gentlemen...On an American One Hundred Dollar Bill there is a portrait of which American statesman? Is it A), George Washington, B) Franklin Roosevelt, C) Benjamin Franklin, D) Abraham Lincoln? Silence from Jamal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pay or play, Jamal? All you have to do is stop now and you walk away with a cool quarter of a million rupees. Decide to play, get the answer wrong and you walk away with absolutely nothing. But, get the answer right and you win a million rupees. So. You decide. Pay or play? A long pause. 86   INT. GALLERY. NIGHT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, he hasn't got a clue. This is going to be a walk-away. Stand by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, he's going to play with him, first. 87   INT. STUDIO. NIGHT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get a lot of hundred dollar bills in your line of work, Jamal?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The minimum tip for my services. Laughter from the audience. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 87   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now I know why my cell phone bill is so high...they pay the chi-wallah in hundred dollar bills!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's C. Benjamin Franklin. A gasp from the audience. Prem is caught off-guard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Woah! We haven't locked the computer, man. You're going to play?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think I just have. Haven't I?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You certainly have. C. Right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right. C.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not confusing your Franklins? Benjamin for Roosevelt?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've never heard of Roosevelt Franklin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a million rupees at stake and he's never heard of Roosevelt Franklin...I can't bear to look. He gives this one to the audience who titter on cue. Jamal looks confused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no. Don't you worry, Jamal. You were asked which statesman is depicted on a hundred dollar bill. You said C. Benjamin Franklin. Ladies and Gentlemen... He presses the computer, pretends to ruminate for a while with his finger pressed to his lips.

direction.raw_text: Jamal Malik- you chose to play not pay. I'm afraid you no longer have two hundred and fifty thousand rupees.... (CONTINUED)

direction.raw_text: . 87   CONTINUED: (2)

direction.raw_text: ...you in fact have one million rupees! Wild applause from the audience. Jamal allows himself a genuine smile. 88   INT. INSPECTOR'S OFFICE. DAY.

direction.raw_text: Who's on the thousand rupee note?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. He waves the note at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Gandhi!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've heard of him. The Inspector kicks his chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't get clever or I'll get the electricity out again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They didn't ask me that question. I don't know why. Ask them. The Inspector stares hard at Jamal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Funny, you don't seem that interested in money. Then, Constable Srinivas stomps back into the office, sweat pouring from him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Platform Seventeen- Has to consult his notebook. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 88   CONTINUED:

direction.raw_text: A statue of Frederick Stevens, architect and builder of Victoria Terminus in -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - yes, yes, Srinivas. The hundred dollar bill. 89   EXT. BOMBAY. DAY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bombay had turned into Mumbai. We descend, down until the lines of ants become people.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The orphanage had gone, the slum had gone, the people.... all gone. And everywhere was building, building, building. Descending even further, we pick out a construction site and then Jamal.... 90   EXT. CONSTRUCTION SITE. DAY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I knew she was here. Somewhere she was here. He turns away, then something catches his eye. Underneath all the scraps of flyers and posters on a broken wall is a corner of something that Jamal recognises. He tears back a poster. Underneath, faded but recognisable is one of their beanbag graffiti advertisements. 91   EXT. SLUM. NIGHT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Evenings, I searched. Days, I worked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 92   EXT. HOTEL. DAY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Room service, good afternoon?... Yes, sir. Two chicken burgers, two fries, one cocoa-cola and one mango lassi and a large bottle of mineral water...Bisleri or Himalayan Spring, Sir?...Certainly, Sir. That will be with you in fifteen minutes, Sir. Thank you. Have a nice day. He hangs up and goes through another set of doors... 95   INT. HOTEL KITCHENS. DAY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two chicken burgers, coke, mango lassi and a bottle of Bisleri. Dozily, Salim gets up and takes a look behind one of the fridges. He chases out a chicken with a desultory kick and sorts through some empty mineral water bottles until he finds a Bisleri bottle. Salim fills the bottle of mineral water from the tap and begins delicately re- sealing the tamper-proof lid with super-glue. Jamal collects cutlery and starts laying out a tray. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 95   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going to Chowpatti again, okay? Want to come?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For God's sake. You got some disease? You force me back to this shit-hole, we leave our friends, a good life, loads of money- for this. Isn't that enough?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We came back to find her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, you did, Jamal, not me. Me, I don't give a shit about her. Plenty of pussy in Bombay for Salim. Oh, yes, sir! You should come down the Cages on Saturday night instead of searching for your lost love.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going to Chowpatti.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "I'm going to Chowpatti". There are nineteen million people in this city, Jamal. Forget her. She's history.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But she wasn't. 96   EXT. BANDRA BANDSTAND. DAY.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Namaste, Sahib. Any kindness you give will be repaid in heaven many times. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 96   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A fifty. And a hundred! Blessings upon you, Sahib.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are many ways of seeing. Arvind puts his hands together and bows deep again. Then, Jamal takes his shoe off and gets out a hundred dollar bill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here. Jamal crouches down and puts the bill into Arvind's hand. His fingers feel it. He sniffs it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dollars. But how many?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One hundred.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now you are playing with me, Sahib.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. I swear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is on it? The pictures. Tell me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A building. With a clock on it. Trees behind it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The other side. Turn it over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A man- it doesn't say his name. He is sort of bald, but has long hair on the sides.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Benjamin Franklin. My God, my God. Thank you, Sahib. You were generous the first time. But this... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 96   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And without even a song? A long pause. Arvind keeps hold of Jamal's arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So you are rich, now, are you, Jamal? I am happy for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am so sorry, Arvind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You got away. I didn't. That is all. No, no tears. Tears mock me all the more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arvind, I am looking for-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - how's your voice, Jamal?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. I haven't sung since- since then. Arvind, I- ARVIND - and your eyes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My eyes? My eyes are fine.
